Class: Renderer

goo\renderer/Renderer

The renderer handles displaying of graphics data to a render context.

new Renderer(object parameters)

Member summary

object capabilities
WebGLRenderingContext context
number currentHeight
number currentWidth
boolean glExtensionCompressedTextureS3TC
boolean glExtensionDepthTexture
boolean glExtensionElementIndexUInt
boolean glExtensionStandardDerivatives
boolean glExtensionTextureFilterAnisotropic
boolean glExtensionTextureFloat
boolean glExtensionTextureFloatLinear
boolean glExtensionTextureHalfFloat
RendererRecord rendererRecord
string shaderPrecision

Can be one of:

  • lowp
  • mediump
  • highp

If the shader doesn't specify a precision, a string declaring this precision will be added.
number viewportHeight
number viewportWidth
number viewportX
number viewportY

Method summary

checkResize (Camera camera)

Checks if this.domElement.offsetWidth or Height / this.downScale is unequal to this.domElement.width or height
if that is the case it will call this.setSize
It also checks if the camera aspect changed and will update it calling camera.setFrustumPerspective()
readPixels (x, y, width, height, store)

Read pixels to a typed array (ArrayBufferView)
render (Entity[] renderList, Camera camera, Light[] lights, RenderTarget renderTarget = null, boolean clear = false)

Renders a "renderable" or a list of renderables. Handles all setup and updates of materials/shaders and states.
setClearColor (number r, number g, number b, number a)

Set the background color of the 3D view. All colors are defined in the range 0.0 - 1.0
setSize (number width, number height)

Sets this.domElement.width and height using the parameters.
Then it calls this.setViewport(0, 0, width, height);
Finally it resets the hardwarePicking.pickingTarget
setViewport (number x, number y, number width, number height)

Sets this.viewportX and viewportY to the parameters or to 0
Sets this.viewportWidth and viewportHeight to the parameters or to this.domElement.width and height.
Finally it calls this.context.viewport(x,y,w,h) with the resulting values.

Constructor

new Renderer(object parameters)

Constructor. It accepts a JSON object containing the settings for the renderer.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object

Renderer settings.

Properties
Name Type Argument Default Description
alpha boolean <optional>
 false

Enables the possibility to render non-opaque pixels
premultipliedAlpha boolean <optional>
 true

Whether the colors are premultiplied with the alpha channel.
antialias boolean <optional>
 true

Enables antialiasing.
stencil boolean <optional>
 false

Enables the stencil buffer.
preserveDrawingBuffer boolean <optional>
 false
canvas canvas <optional>

If not supplied, Renderer will create a new canvas
onError function(string) <optional>

Called with message when error occurs

Members

capabilities :object

Properties:
Name Type Description
maxTexureSize number

Maximum 2D texture size
maxCubemapSize number

Maximum cubemap size
maxRenderbufferSize number

Maximum renderbuffer size
maxViewPortDims number[]

Maximum viewport size [x, y]
maxVertexTextureUnits number

Maximum vertex shader texture units
maxFragmentTextureUnits number

Maximum fragment shader texture units
maxCombinedTextureUnits number

Maximum total texture units
maxVertexAttributes number

Maximum vertex attributes
maxVertexUniformVectors number

Maximum vertex uniform vectors
maxFragmentUniformVectors number

Maximum fragment uniform vectors
maxVaryingVectors number

Maximum varying vectors
aliasedPointSizeRange number

Point size min/max [min, max]
aliasedLineWidthRange number

Line width min/max [min, max]
samples number

Antialiasing sample size
sampleBuffers number

Sample buffer count
depthBits number

Depth bits
stencilBits number

Stencil bits
subpixelBits number

Sub-pixel bits
supportedExtensionsList number

Supported extension as an array
renderer number

Renderer name
vendor number

Vendor name
version number

Version string
shadingLanguageVersion number

Shadinglanguage version string

context :WebGLRenderingContext

currentHeight :number

currentWidth :number

glExtensionCompressedTextureS3TC :boolean

glExtensionDepthTexture :boolean

glExtensionElementIndexUInt :boolean

glExtensionStandardDerivatives :boolean

glExtensionTextureFilterAnisotropic :boolean

glExtensionTextureFloat :boolean

glExtensionTextureFloatLinear :boolean

glExtensionTextureHalfFloat :boolean

rendererRecord :RendererRecord

shaderPrecision :string

Can be one of:

  • lowp
  • mediump
  • highp

If the shader doesn't specify a precision, a string declaring this precision will be added.

viewportHeight :number

viewportWidth :number

viewportX :number

viewportY :number

Methods

checkResize(Camera camera)

Checks if this.domElement.offsetWidth or Height / this.downScale is unequal to this.domElement.width or height
if that is the case it will call this.setSize
It also checks if the camera aspect changed and will update it calling camera.setFrustumPerspective()

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
camera Camera <optional>

optional camera argument

readPixels(x, y, width, height, store)

Read pixels to a typed array (ArrayBufferView)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x

x offset of rectangle to read from
y

y offset of rectangle to read from
width

width of rectangle to read from
height

height of rectangle to read from
store

ArrayBufferView to store data in (Uint8Array)

render(Entity[] renderList, Camera camera, Light[] lights, RenderTarget renderTarget = null, boolean clear = false)

Renders a "renderable" or a list of renderables. Handles all setup and updates of materials/shaders and states.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
renderList Entity[]

A list of "renderables". Eg Entities with the right components or objects with mesh data, material and transform
camera Camera

Main camera for rendering
lights Light[]

Lights used in the rendering
renderTarget RenderTarget <optional>
 null

Optional rendertarget to use as target for rendering, or null to render to the screen
clear boolean <optional>
 false

true/false to clear or not clear all types, or an object in the form {color:true/false, depth:true/false, stencil:true/false}

setClearColor(number r, number g, number b, number a)

Set the background color of the 3D view. All colors are defined in the range 0.0 - 1.0

Parameters:
Name Type Description
r number

Red
g number

Green
b number

Blue
a number

Alpha

setSize(number width, number height)

Sets this.domElement.width and height using the parameters.
Then it calls this.setViewport(0, 0, width, height);
Finally it resets the hardwarePicking.pickingTarget

Parameters:
Name Type Description
width number
height number

setViewport(number x, number y, number width, number height)

Sets this.viewportX and viewportY to the parameters or to 0
Sets this.viewportWidth and viewportHeight to the parameters or to this.domElement.width and height.
Finally it calls this.context.viewport(x,y,w,h) with the resulting values.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
x number <optional>

optional x coordinate
y number <optional>

optional y coordinate
width number <optional>

optional width coordinate
height number <optional>

optional height coordinate
